page.title: 20Social Changes in the Area.
page.content: {Killingholme Haven}was more of a community than now.There were 8 houses and bungalows at the top of{ {Station Road,}now demolished. The{ {station,}was closed down in 1961. The railway ran between the ferries at{New {Holland and Immingham.}The buildings no longer survive, except for the {station-master's house,}(an exact replica of the one at East Halton). { Buses}no longer serve the area. The{school}has been knocked down; only the{school-house}stands. There is no trace of the{General Store}down{Marsh {Lane.}Industry has brought some {benefits.}The houses were connected to {mains}water and electricity. Before, they used a{wind pump}in the station yard. The lanes are also kept clear of snow in winter.
